alert.note: Alert for Jefferson; Orleans (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 10 at 12:17PM CDT until August 10 at 4:00PM CDT by NWS New Orleans
info.description: The National Weather Service in New Orleans has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... North Central Jefferson Parish in southeastern Louisiana... West Central Orleans Parish in southeastern Louisiana... * Until 400 PM CDT. * At 1217 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Up to 1 inch of rain has fallen in the past hour and up to 2 inches has fallen so far today. The expected rainfall rate is 2 to 4 inches in an hour. Flash flooding is expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low- lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... New Orleans, Metairie, Marrero, Avondale, Harvey, Jefferson, Gretna, Westwego, Bridge City and Elmwood. This includes the following Interstates... Interstate 10 in Louisiana between mile markers 227 and 236. Interstate 610 near mile marker 1. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED EXPECTED RAINFALL RATE...2-4 INCHES IN 1 HOUR
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
